definition: leading small group (LSG), a CCP body that exercises general oversight on matters relating to a specific area (LSG for foreign affairs 外事工作, LSG for comprehensively deepening reforms 全面深化改革 etc)/aka central leading group
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries

sentences.english: To assume the functions and responsibilities of the Foreign Affairs Office of the autonomous region.
sentences.chinese: 承担区委外事工作领导小组办公室的职责。

sentences.english: The leading group decided to tell a11 the workers to lake part in the strike.
sentences.chinese: 领导小组决定通知所有的工人参加罢工。

sentences.english: He was Chen Xiwen , Chairman of the Central Finance and Economy Leading Team Office.
sentences.chinese: 这个人叫陈锡文，中央财经领导小组办公室主任。

sentences.english: Reassigns 40 cadre to establish the leading group office.
sentences.chinese: 抽调40名干部成立领导小组办公室。

sentences.english: The school will set up a leading group to discuss and choose suitable students.
sentences.chinese: 学校成立招生领导小组，集体讨论，择优录取。

sentences.english: Fifthly it is proposed to set up a multi-tiered high rank leading team to carry out unified coordination.
sentences.chinese: 第五，建议成立高层次领导小组，进行统筹协调工作。

sentences.english: To assume the functions and responsibilities of the Municipal Foreign Affairs Office.
sentences.chinese: 承担市委外事工作领导小组办公室的职责。

sentences.english: The deputy governors, in charge of agriculture, served as the heads.
sentences.chinese: 领导小组的组长由一位主管农业的副县长担任。

sentences.english: To assume the functions and responsibilities of the District Foreign Affairs Office.
sentences.chinese: 承担区委外事工作领导小组办公室的职责。

sentences.english: To assume the functions and responsibilities of the Prefectural Foreign Affairs Office.
sentences.chinese: 承担州委外事工作领导小组办公室的职责。

sentences.english: To assume the functions and responsibilities of the Provincial Foreign Affairs Office.
sentences.chinese: 承担省委外事工作领导小组办公室的职责。

definition: to lead (an animal by the head)/to take the lead/to coordinate (a combined operation)/to mediate/a go-between (e.g. marriage broker)
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
to call a conference/to convene a meeting
